result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erica L Helton

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  State's Response to Motion to Suppress.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court.  Attorney Justin Padway in court for Erica L Helton.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense filed a motion to suppress and requested motion hearing date.  State's response to be filed on or before October 13, 2022.  Defense reply to be filed on or before November 10, 2022. Court adjourns matter for Decision. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.
Decision scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Unreasonable Search of Home.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court with attorney Ethan M. Padway.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Francesco Mineo.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.  Case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 40, Rm 634 CH.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court with attorney Justin Padway.   Jessica Bellows on behalf of Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for an Arraignment. Case called with co-defendant COLLINS 2022CF1005. Original Information e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Parties request a scheduling date. Case adjounred, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court with Attorney Justin Padway; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Rom. Court took judicial notice of 21CF565.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defense given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court with Attorney Justin Padway; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; serving search warrant. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court in person with Attorney Justin Padway who appeared by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Padway is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
FILED.

Case set for Indigency Hearing. Indigency Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Justin Padway, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning 6-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
All previous conditions remain.
Case set for return on warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Defendant provided with zoom information for Branch 30 instead of Prelim Court. Court reinstates bail at $5,000.00.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court.  Jessica Bellows on behalf of Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Defendant Erica L Helton not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Erica L Helton in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
03/03/22.    22RM012255
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/22 @ 2:30p
